title: Good agricultural practice | Wikipedia audio article

tasks.task: Enact Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) and Good Handling Practices (GHP)
subtasks: Implement principles for on-farm production and post-production processes
Safeguard the safety and health of food and non-food agricultural products
Consider economic, social, and environmental sustainability
Apply sustainable agricultural methods
Maintain a common database on integrated production techniques per agro-ecological region
Use soil management practices (e.g., hedging, ditching, fertilizers) to reduce erosion and improve nitrogen balance
Adjust irrigation schedules based on plant needs and soil water reserves, preventing drainage and salinization
Restore and maintain wetlands and wetland habitats
Enhance animal welfare by preventing distress and maintaining normal behavior
Avoid therapeutic feeding practices and reduce use of antibiotics and hormones
Prevent chemical residues in food supply chains
Apply traceability processes throughout the production chain

tasks.task: Operate USDA GAP and GHP certification programs
subtasks: Verify conformance to USDA's Guide to Minimize Microbial Food Safety Hazards
Implement and update certification programs for various commodities
Participate in standard harmonization initiatives (e.g., Produce GAP Harmonized Food Safety Standard)

tasks.task: Adhere to principles for renewable resource management and soil improvement
subtasks: Increase organic matter in soil through manure and crop rotations
Limit soil compaction and heavy tillage
Conduct green manuring with pulse crops

tasks.task: Ensure lift safety and compliance with Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) and Good Handling Practices (GHP)
subtasks: Verify the safe_window status for the lift
Adhere to "liftsafe" standards, including regular checks and documentation
Familiarize yourself with the Cub's operation and relevant safety protocols
Maintain traceability and record-keeping of safe_window status
Face the envelop (e.g., control panel or documentation station) for safety procedures
Check the safe_window periodically (e.g., every hour, as per guidelines)
Address any safe_window issues immediately and report them
Abide by USDA GAP and GHP certification requirements, including traceability and safety audits
Participate in harmonization initiatives for standardization (if applicable)
Implement sustainable soil and water management practices (as per GAP principles)
Monitor and maintain animal welfare standards (e.g., residue-free, preventive care)
Apply integrated pest management and minimize chemical inputs to prevent residues

tasks.task: Ensure lift safety and compliance with GAP/GHP standards**
subtasks: ** Verify the safe_window status for the lift.
** Adhere to "liftsafe" standards, including routine checks and documentation.
** Familiarize yourself with the Cub's operation and safety protocols.
** Maintain traceability and record-keeping of the safe_window status.
** Check the safe_window periodically (e.g., every hour) as per guidelines.
** Address any safe_window issues immediately and report them.
** Abide by USDA GAP and GHP certification requirements, including traceability and safety audits.
** Participate in harmonization initiatives for standardization (if applicable).
** Implement sustainable soil and water management practices (as per GAP principles).
** Monitor and maintain animal welfare standards (e.g., residue-free, preventive care).
** Apply integrated pest management and minimize chemical inputs to prevent residues.

tasks.task: Implement sustainable soil and water management
subtasks: Maintain hedging and ditching for erosion control
Apply fertilizers appropriately (e.g., nitrogen balance) without excess
Practice crop rotation to enhance soil organic content
Schedule irrigation based on plant and soil needs
Avoid drainage and prevent salt buildup
Utilize water recycling techniques and permanent soil cover

tasks.task: Ensure animal welfare and responsible production
subtasks: Regularly check and maintain the proper handling and housing for livestock
Avoid non-therapeutic antibiotics and hormones in animal feed
Manage waste and transportation to reduce ecological impact

tasks.task: Adhere to USDA GAP and GHP guidelines
subtasks: Follow USDA's Guide to Minimize Microbial Food Safety Hazards
Apply commodity-specific audit programs (e.g., tomatoes, leafy greens)
Participate in producing and updating certification programs
